- Friendly atmosphere

review_title: Company going downhill in a hurry.
job_title: Direct Support Professional in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Pay is ok for the field but low, benefits are pretty good.
cons: CEO shows no leadership as to where the company is going and is passive and not communicating with the employees, people are being let go who have worked there for years, quality of staff is going downhill, lack of trust, and nobody is dealing with these issues.  Supervisors are quitting at a fast rate.   Is the Board of Directors asleep also?  Apparently so.  The environment is toxic, for the most part.

review_title: This Organization Doesn't Care About Its Employees
job_title: Training Specialist in Saint Paul, MN
pros: The people CIP supports are powerful and cared about me way more than any higher level employees ever did!
cons: This was the worst work environment I have ever been privy to. It was rife with terrible communication, harassment, and antipathy on the part of many staff toward the people we served. There was no support for entry-level employees, and we were routinely denied paid breaks. They couldn't even give us the day after Thanksgiving off paid -- yet they closed down all of our locations so we were unable to work. There is a reason you can't retain your employees, so do better. I would not recommend a friend work here in any capacity, or attend any of CIP's programs. I could write a novel right now but won't waste any more of my time on this organization.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Minneapolis, MN
pros: Managers care about you as an employee and have your back. Company strives to provide good care for clients and recognize employee accomplishments. Coworkers are positive teammates, positive work atmosphere. Company strives to provide good client care and support its employees to get the job done.
cons: Low pay rate...but that is generally expected in the human services field. You can gain valuable experience and try for higher level positions.

pros:
Flexible hours
Work with Customers directly
Management does not interfere
Good Pay
Have fun with different people assuming you can handle taking care of the disabled.
cons:
Benefits are not good compared to other jobs out there.
No Vacation.
No set schedule; however, you can set schedules with clients.
Some clients require a lot of care.

pros: It was Monday- Friday hours 8-4, working with people with disabilities, taking them out in the community. Working with great staffs.
cons: The winter months where you have to take them out in the community
